title: Utilities Up On Defensive Bias — Utilities Roundup
text:
Shares of power producers rose as traders rotated into defensive areas because of a surprisingly weak batch of earnings reports.

The Trump administration filed suit Wednesday to shut down California's emissions-trading market designed to limit air pollution, claiming it is unconstitutional because it is run in cooperation with the Canadian province of Quebec.

PG&E said it would begin shutting off power to 179,000 customers in 17 California counties on Wednesday afternoon, its second major intentional blackout this month, in an attempt to avert wildfires like the devastating Camp Fire from 2018.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 17:03 ET (21:03 GMT)
